Detect if aesthetic parameter is static color or variable mapping

Source: R/utils.R
detect_aesthetic_type.Rd

Intelligently determines whether a user-provided aesthetic parameter (color/fill) is a static color string ("blue", "#FF0000") or a variable mapping (column name or expression). This enables intuitive API where both use cases work naturally.

Usage

detect_aesthetic_type(quo, param_name = "parameter", data = NULL)

Arguments

quo

Quosure from rlang::enquo()

param_name

Character. Parameter name for error messages (e.g., "color", "fill")

data

Data frame to evaluate variable in (optional). If provided, enables detection of continuous vs discrete variables.

Value

List with:

  • type: "missing", "static_color", or "variable_mapping"

  • value: The static color value (if type = "static_color")

  • is_continuous: Logical (if type = "variable_mapping" and data provided)

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# In a function context:
my_plot <- function(data, x, y, color = NULL) {
  color_quo <- rlang::enquo(color)
  color_type <- detect_aesthetic_type(color_quo, "color", data)

  if (color_type$type == "static_color") {
    # Use static color
    geom_point(color = color_type$value)
  } else if (color_type$type == "variable_mapping") {
    # Use aes() mapping
    geom_point(aes(color = {{color}}))
  }
}
} # }
